DataElement.preferredDefinition: The boundary characteristics of an abnormal condition of the fold of peritoneum originating at the stomach and supporting the viscera.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A fold of peritoneum originating at the stomach and supporting the viscera._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A description of the boundary configuration of a sample.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/19/18 ls Released per CIP PI review (Justin, Brenda).6/15/18 jk created for CIP TCIA/TCGA OV features project.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority.: A morphologic architectural pattern characterized by the presence of proliferating non-neoplastic or neoplastic cells forming single or multiple nodules within a lesion.

Concepts.definition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority.
A morphologic architectural pattern characterized by the presence of proliferating non-neoplastic or neoplastic cells forming single or multiple nodules within a lesion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority.: A morphologic architectural pattern in which a cellular population is distributed in a relatively uniform fashion throughout a specified tissue area; not focal.

Concepts.definition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority.
A morphologic architectural pattern in which a cellular population is distributed in a relatively uniform fashion throughout a specified tissue area; not focal.
